com.defano.jmonet.tools.base

Class BasicTool<DelegateType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.defano.jmonet.tools.base.BasicTool<DelegateType>
  • Type Parameters:
    DelegateType - The object type of the delegate class used by this tool.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    SurfaceInteractionObserver, Tool, KeyListener, EventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArrowTool, BoundsTool, FillTool, LinearTool, MagnifierTool, PathTool, PolylineTool, SelectionTool, TextTool

    public class BasicTool<DelegateType>
extends Object
implements Tool, SurfaceInteractionObserver
    A base tool class providing configuration-specific attributes (like stroke and fill), activation state management (which canvas the tool is active on, if any) and a reference to the tool's delegate.

    • Method Detail

      • activate

        public void activate(PaintCanvas canvas)
        Activates this tool on a given canvas.

        A paint tool does not "paint" on the canvas until it is activated. Typically, only one tool is active on a canvas at any given time, but there is no technical limitation preventing multiple tools from being active at once. While a canvas may have multiple active tools drawing on it, a tool can only be active on a single canvas.

        Use Tool.deactivate() to stop this tool from painting on the canvas.

        Specified by:
        activate in interface Tool
        Parameters:
        canvas - The paint canvas on which to activate the tool.

      • deactivate

        public void deactivate()
        Deactivates the tool on the canvas. Invoking this method on a tool this is not presently activated has no effect. A deactivated tool no longer affects the canvas and all listeners / observers are un-subscribed making the tool available for garbage collection.
        Specified by:
        deactivate in interface Tool

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Determines if this tool is presently active on a canvas. A tool is considered active after a call to Tool.activate(PaintCanvas) has been made, but before a call to Tool.deactivate().
        Specified by:
        isActive in interface Tool
        Returns:
        True if the tool is active, false otherwise.

      • getToolCursor

        public Cursor getToolCursor()
        Gets the default mouse cursor used when painting with this tool. Note that specific tools may provide methods for getting and setting auxiliary cursors that are active during tool-specific states, too.
        Specified by:
        getToolCursor in interface Tool
        Returns:
        The default tool cursor.

      • setToolCursor

        public void setToolCursor(Cursor toolCursor)
        Sets the default mouse cursor used when painting with this tool.
        Specified by:
        setToolCursor in interface Tool
        Parameters:
        toolCursor - The default mouse cursor.

      • getCanvas

        public PaintCanvas getCanvas()
        Gets the canvas on which this tool is currently painting, or null, if the tool has not been activated (via a call to Tool.activate(PaintCanvas)).
        Specified by:
        getCanvas in interface Tool
        Returns:
        The canvas this tool is painting on, or null

      • getScratch

        public Scratch getScratch()
        Gets the scratch buffer of the canvas that this tool is presently activated on, applying this tool's anti- aliasing mode to the scratch buffer's graphics context.
        Specified by:
        getScratch in interface Tool
        Returns:
        The active scratch buffer.
